intro: Eremophila incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved emu bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and produces spikes of showy, pinkish-red flowers. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy shrub. Eremophila incisa is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
